channel.title: Create a Secure, Buildable Application and a CI Workflow :: Container Registry Security with Vulnerability Scanning and Policy Enforcement
channel.description: Create the Sample Application and Dockerfile First, we need something to build. We’ll create a very simple Node.js “Hello World” application and a security-conscious Dockerfile. In your secure-container-pipeline project directory, create a new folder named app. mkdir app cd app Create the Node.js application file app.js: # In the 'app' directory touch app.js Paste this simple server code into app/app.js: // app/app.js const http = require("http"); const port = 8080; const server = http.createServer((req, res) => { res.statusCode = 200; res.setHeader("Content-Type", "text/plain"); res.end("Hello, FCJ-ers!\n"); }); server.listen(port, () => { console.log(`Server running on port ${port}`); }); Create the Dockerfile:
